intro: Nenga pumila var. pachystachya, commonly known as the narrowleaf pachystachya, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided leaves. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
